roles.name: Military Officer
roles.description: Leads military units, develops strategic/tactical plans, and coordinates missions in various defense scenarios.

meta.typicalBackground: Military academy or ROTC, leadership training, specialized domain (infantry, navy, air force)
challenges: Maintaining troop morale, threat unpredictability, ethical dilemmas in conflict zones

sampleUseCase.scenario: An officer organizes a peacekeeping patrol in a conflict-prone area, balancing local community engagement, force protection, and mission directives.

roles.name: Defense Acquisition Specialist
roles.description: Manages procurement of military equipment and services, negotiating contracts and overseeing lifecycle costs.

meta.typicalBackground: Logistics or acquisitions background, knowledge of defense procurement regulations, cost-benefit analyses
challenges: Long lead times, complex compliance, balancing performance specs vs. budget constraints

sampleUseCase.scenario: A specialist coordinates an RFP for new armored vehicles, ensuring vendor proposals meet ballistic protection standards, then negotiates a multi-year supply contract.

roles.name: Intelligence Analyst
roles.description: Collects, synthesizes, and interprets information from multiple sources to inform strategic or tactical decisions.

meta.typicalBackground: Criminal justice, political science, or international relations plus intelligence training
keyTools: Geospatial analysis, signal intercepts, HUMINT data, classified databases
challenges: Processing huge data volumes, discerning credible sources, rapidly evolving threats (cyber, terror)

sampleUseCase.scenario: An analyst compiles satellite imagery, intercepted communications, and local insights to predict an imminent insurgent attack, prompting preemptive defense maneuvers.

roles.name: Cyber Warfare Expert
roles.description: Develops and executes offensive/defensive cyber strategies, protecting defense networks and targeting adversary systems as authorized.

meta.typicalBackground: Computer science, cybersecurity certifications, specialized training in network intrusion or cryptography
keyTools: Offensive security tools, advanced encryption systems, zero-day exploit knowledge
challenges: Attribution complexities, legal/ethical constraints, cat-and-mouse with advanced persistent threats

sampleUseCase.scenario: A cyber warfare unit neutralizes a detected ransomware infiltration by reversing malicious code, shutting down external command servers, and patching vulnerabilities in critical infrastructure systems.

roles.name: Logistics & Supply Officer
roles.description: Manages supply chains for military equipment, rations, and resources across bases or deployed units, ensuring operational readiness.

meta.typicalBackground: Military logistics or supply chain background, familiarity with deployment cycles and strategic transport
challenges: Harsh field conditions, piracy or theft, limited transport capacity, short shelf-life for certain supplies

sampleUseCase.scenario: A logistics officer coordinates an airlift of humanitarian aid and ammunition to a remote forward base, balancing cargo priorities, flight schedules, and risk assessments.
